comment: The function ` F ` enumerates all equivalence classes in ` Z/nZ ` for each ` n ` . When ` n = 0 ` , ` ZZ / 0 ZZ = ZZ / { 0 } ~~ ZZ ` so we let ` W = ZZ ` ; otherwise ` W = { 0 , ... , n - 1 } ` enumerates all the equivalence classes. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jun-2015.)
